Software Description: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) is a remote administration tool and backdoor that can be downloaded from the Internet, particularly from Chinese hacker websites. It has been used since at least 2004.(Citation: FireEye APT41 Aug 2019)(Citation: Talos ZxShell Oct 2014 )
Mitigation Description: Perform audits or scans of systems, permissions, insecure software, insecure configurations, etc. to identify potential weaknesses.
Application: Audit the Remote Desktop Users group membership regularly. Remove unnecessary accounts and groups from Remote Desktop Users groups
Use: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) has remote desktop functionality.

Software Description: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) is a remote administration tool and backdoor that can be downloaded from the Internet, particularly from Chinese hacker websites. It has been used since at least 2004.(Citation: FireEye APT41 Aug 2019)(Citation: Talos ZxShell Oct 2014 )
Mitigation Description: Use capabilities to prevent suspicious behavior patterns from occurring on endpoint systems. This could include suspicious process, file, API call, etc. behavior.
Application: Some endpoint security solutions can be configured to block some types of process injection based on common sequences of behavior that occur during the injection process.
Use: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) is injected into a shared SVCHOST process.

Mitigation Description: Use network appliances to filter ingress or egress traffic and perform protocol-based filtering. Configure software on endpoints to filter network traffic.
Application: Leverage services provided by Content Delivery Networks (CDN) or providers specializing in DoS mitigations to filter traffic upstream from services. Filter boundary traffic by blocking source addresses sourcing the attack, blocking ports that are being targeted, or blocking protocols being used for transport. To defend against SYN floods, enable SYN Cookies.
Use: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) has a feature to perform SYN flood attack on a host.

Mitigation Description: Use intrusion detection signatures to block traffic at network boundaries.
Application: Network intrusion detection and prevention systems that use network signatures to identify traffic for specific adversary malware can be used to mitigate activity at the network level.
Use: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) has used HTTP and FTP for connections.

Software Description: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) is a remote administration tool and backdoor that can be downloaded from the Internet, particularly from Chinese hacker websites. It has been used since at least 2004.(Citation: FireEye APT41 Aug 2019)(Citation: Talos ZxShell Oct 2014 )
Mitigation Description: Use intrusion detection signatures to block traffic at network boundaries.
Application: Network intrusion detection and prevention systems that use network signatures to identify traffic for specific adversary malware can be used to mitigate activity at the network level. Signatures are often for unique indicators within protocols and may be based on the specific protocol used by a particular adversary or tool, and will likely be different across various malware families and versions. Adversaries will likely change tool C2 signatures over time or construct protocols in such a way as to avoid detection by common defensive tools.
Use: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) uses common ports such as 80 and 443 for C2.

Mitigation Description: Restrict access by setting directory and file permissions that are not specific to users or privileged accounts.
Application: Protect generated event files that are stored locally with proper permissions and authentication and limit opportunities for adversaries to increase privileges by preventing Privilege Escalation opportunities.
Use: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) has a command to clear system event logs.

Software Description: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) is a remote administration tool and backdoor that can be downloaded from the Internet, particularly from Chinese hacker websites. It has been used since at least 2004.(Citation: FireEye APT41 Aug 2019)(Citation: Talos ZxShell Oct 2014 )
Mitigation Description: Manage the creation, modification, use, and permissions associated to user accounts.
Application: Ensure proper user permissions are in place to prevent adversaries from disabling or interfering with security services.
Use: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) can disable the firewall by modifying the registry key HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\SharedAccess\Parameters\FirewallPolicy\StandardProfile and killing AV products' processes.

Software Description: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) is a remote administration tool and backdoor that can be downloaded from the Internet, particularly from Chinese hacker websites. It has been used since at least 2004.(Citation: FireEye APT41 Aug 2019)(Citation: Talos ZxShell Oct 2014 )
Mitigation Description: Manage the creation, modification, use, and permissions associated to user accounts.
Application: Limit remote user permissions if remote access is necessary.
Use: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) has remote desktop functionality.

Software Description: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) is a remote administration tool and backdoor that can be downloaded from the Internet, particularly from Chinese hacker websites. It has been used since at least 2004.(Citation: FireEye APT41 Aug 2019)(Citation: Talos ZxShell Oct 2014 )
Mitigation Description: Manage the creation, modification, use, and permissions associated to user accounts.
Application: Limit privileges of user accounts and remediate Privilege Escalation vectors so only  authorized administrators can create new services.
Use: [ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) can create a new service using the service parser function ProcessScCommand.
